reviewText: I am up watching the 2am late night movie on FOX and took me a while to find the name of this movie because TV Guide did not list it but once I did find the title name I liked the name and am still watching it.  So far this family moves into a big house blowing all their lifes savings only to to move in and start having strange things happen around the house at night like flushing toilets, TV turning on by itself, shadows of a man walking through thier house, a old balck man apearing telling to not dig up thier yard because this couple is burried there then is gone when you look away and look back, just plain strange evil stuff.  The insurance company won't help, and all the nieghbors are suffering from the same goings-on so what do you think happens?  Yup, the Mom gets mad and  goes nuts and starts diggin them dead folks up!  As for any idea how the movie ends I don't know cause it's still on.  My hope is it ends good.  Check it out cause from what I have seen it's a great movie to watch on a day you have nothing to do but to relax for once and enjoy something good.  PS prepare your self for the dead kittens scene, this is when they were allowed to show the real thing. (yeah maggots and all, kinda surprised they'd show that on tv, but it is late-late night.  Enjoy
summary: There's dead people in your backyard!!!

reviewText: This movie is a little slow going in the middle of the storyline but really quite interesting. You'd be surprised what people are willing to do when it involves money. This show is very good and is a typical good scary film that addresses a real life issue. It's not really gross and was a good movie to watch on Mothers day.This kind of thing does not just happen in the area this is filmed but a lot of places. At 'Turkey Creek' in Mississippi they kept a few graves labeled but there now is an apartment building and other things on top of what used to be an African American cemetery. They detail it in the documentary film 'Come Hell or High Water: The Battle for Turkey Creek' which I also recommend highly and it has a part in the film where they talk about burrying over a grave yard. It's really sad.

reviewText: This movie depicts the true story of the community of Hilltop Drive and the actual events that the movie Poltergeist was based on. A community of houses built on an old graveyard, who's residents experienced supernatural goings on. I love the movie Poltergeist, but this honest account based on the book written by the actual victims without all the crazy special effects and dramatizations is very good, the acting is above par, and I found this movie creepy and entertaining.

reviewText: I have been burned by heeding Amazon reviewers so many times that I generally ignore them but since this Patty Duke film had only a single review...well, I looked at it and sure enough, once again I saw the term, "documented to be true", once again referring to the happenings in this film.I have spent some time in various libraries and more time doing research online and I have YET to see events such as shown in this film actually "documented to be true". Sure, there are claims that supernatural events have happened but like visiting aliens there is simply never any proof involved or honest substantiation of any sort.....ever.It kinda reminds me of what a friend of mine told me when he expressed his amazement that it appeared that EVERYONE claiming to have been abducted (not the premise of this movie), seems to live in a trailer home.Rather than exaggerating claims of "documentation", lets just enjoy filmed novellas for what they are. Entertainment at best, disappointing waste of time at worse.As for reviewing this movie, it was somewhat entertaining and "dated" it indeed was. But at least honest effort went into its making and the acting was well done. I was "entertained"......and I guess I just documented that fact.
summary: What is meant by "documented to be true"?

reviewText: I enjoyed The Legacy of Hilltop Drive quite alot, even though it wasn't all that scary.  Sure, there are some creepy scenes, but the movie didn't scare me.  Despite this I liked the film, in which a kid goes to stay with  her grandparents and gets spooked out.  There aren't many times when  special effects are used, but the one main time when they are really makes  you jump!  There are quite a few scenes that remeind you of ones from The  Exorcist and Poltergiest, and even though they have been done before they  are still quite spooky.  Quite a good film.

reviewText: I know Patty Duke was in lots of films between The Patty Duke Show and this movie, most notably as Helen Keller in The Miracle Worker, but I couldn't resist going back in time. Grave Secrets is based on a true event where the spirits of those buried come to haunt the houses on Hilltop Drive whose owners don't realize there is a cemetery under their houses. Patty plays a wife and mother who takes charge of her granddaughter while her daughter is away. right after moving in, Patty hears the sound of a toilet flushing, only there is no one there to flush it. Later, her granddaughter sees shadows on the wall no one else sees. As in any haunted-house movie, things build up until the climax and the secret of Hilltop Drive is revealed. While other movies were better, such as The Haunting and The Legend of Hell House, it is neverthless unnerving in part because this one is real, and in part because of the acting and special effects. I have it on a video along with Ghost Story, Poltergeist, The Haunted (not The Haunting, but based on fact) and The Uninvited (also based on fact). You can see I like haunted-house movies, and Grave Secrets is a satisfying end to the tape. Not top quality, but still good.
summary: YOU ARE NOT IN BROOKLYN ANYMORE

reviewText: ~These people were portrayed as intelligent, educated yet they weren't smart enough of go to the public library to research on the history of their property & town?Libraries, especially in an old town as was portrayed in this movie, has vast information... old newspapers, old photos, local books and stories ect...Or research the county office where the property records/deeds are held.So many places to research for the things to not only get their money back by proving their case that their house was built on top of a cemetery but to keep the dead resting happy too.That was another thing that really upset me... why did it not bother any of them that the dead were being disrespected!The parents admitted that the house made their daughter deathly ill (cancer) yet they invite her & her newborn over!What kind of parents do that? Either not very smart ones or ones that want bad things to happen to her again, but they were portrayed as loving parents!If this is a 'true' story, which I doubt, why didn't they take their story to the media? The media would have jumped on it! Current Affairs thrived on stories like that back then.

reviewText: I love these 80s made-for-tv supernatural dramas, and "Grave Secrets" was an interesting watch, primarily because of the strong lead performances by Patty Duke and David Selby. Both actors play a middle-aged couple, Jean and Shag Williams, who pour their life savings into a new home situated in a new housing development. Their granddaughter (from their oldest daughter) and their younger daughter who is engaged to be married live with them. As soon as the family moves into their new home, strange events begin to plague the family - the daughter gets stricken by a rare type of cancer, the young granddaughter sees shadows moving around the house, Jean keeps hearing the bathroom toilet being flushed when no one else is around, and even Shag sees something bizarre.Initially, Shag refuses to buy into Jean's theory that the house may be haunted. But as Jean digs deeper, she makes some eerie discoveries. The neighbor across the street has his yard dug up and makes a gruesome discovery in the form of a pair of skeletal remains, and later Jean finds out that her home together with the homes of some of her neighbors were built on land that used to be known as the Black Hole Addition, and was the burial ground for hundreds of former slaves dating back to the Civil War era. As the hauntings become more malevolent in nature, Jean and Shag are desperate to move their family out, but with their financial resources stretched thin, they have limited options.The acting by Patty Duke and David Selby makes this an engrossing watch, and given that it is based on true life haunting accounts by residents of the real Black Hope area, it made it an even creepier viewing experience. There are some credible moments of suspense and reminded me of the more classic and atmospheric horror movies I've watched in the past. The movie also reminded me of the film Poltergeist, but a little more low-key, without the expensive special effects. If you enjoy suspenseful supernatural dramas and are tolerant of the 80s feel of this movie, then this might be worth your time.
Title: N/A
